wikipedia_page.main: Stefanie Marsh is a British journalist, author and a senior features writer at The Times. She has been a correspondent in Palestine for The Times, and was one of the first English-speaking reporters to cover the Fritzl case in 2008.In 2006 she was nominated as feature writer of the year at the British Press Awards for her reports from Mount Everest.

response: On 16 June 2008, the newspaper The Times published an in-depth interview with Kampusch by Bojan Pancevski and Stefanie Marsh.

The 2009 book, The Crimes of Josef Fritzl: Uncovering the Truth, by Stefanie Marsh and Bojan Pancevski, is about the case. Room author Emma Donoghue was inspired by the crimes, and her novel inspired a film adaptation with the same name.
